alert.note: Alert for Jefferson (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 14 at 2:58PM CDT until July 14 at 3:30PM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: The National Weather Service in Topeka has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northeastern Jefferson County in northeastern Kansas... * Until 330 PM CDT. * At 258 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Oskaloosa, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * Locations impacted include... Oskaloosa, McLouth, Ozawkie, Winchester and Perry Lake. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
